title: Split todoist-gtd for claude-skills migration
description:
Separate the generic Todoist CLI from the user-specific GTD semantic layer so the CLI can be shared via claude-skills while keeping personal context private.

**Current state:** Single skill contains both:
- Generic CLI (scripts/todoist.py) - API wrapper, auth, commands
- User-specific skill (SKILL.md, references/) - GTD coaching, Sameer's structure, terminology

**Target state:**
- Generic package: `todoist-cli` skill with CLI + minimal docs (shareable)
- User-specific: remains here or in ~/.claude/skills with personal GTD structure
design:
## Approach

Split into two packages:
1. **todoist-cli** (generic, shareable)
   - `scripts/todoist.py` - the CLI itself
   - Minimal SKILL.md - CLI reference only
   - No user-specific structure assumptions
   
2. **todoist-gtd** (user-specific, stays private)
   - SKILL.md focused on GTD coaching + Sameer's structure
   - References: COACHING.md, PATTERNS.md, TERMINOLOGY.md
   - Imports/depends on todoist-cli for data access

## Key decisions needed
- Where does generic CLI live? (new repo? claude-skills?)
- How do skills depend on each other? (symlink? copy?)
- What's the minimum viable generic skill?

## Workflow
1. DRAW-DOWN: Create TodoWrite items from acceptance criteria
2. Work through items, check direction at each completion
3. Update notes at milestones
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] Generic todoist-cli skill exists with CLI + minimal docs
- [ ] Generic skill makes no assumptions about user's Todoist structure
- [ ] todoist-gtd skill remains with GTD coaching + user-specific context
- [ ] todoist-gtd can use todoist-cli for data access
- [ ] Both skills work independently (no circular deps)
- [ ] Documented how to set up the dependency
close_reason: Reconsidered â€” todoist-gtd is already in desired state (CLI + skill + GTD opinions bundled together). No split needed.

title: todoist-gtd is production-ready
description: Hardening from Jan 2026 audit: robust error handling, complete dependencies, quality documentation, no silent failures.
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] Fresh install works (pip install + auth)
- [ ] Name resolution handles all project names
- [ ] CLI errors are clean and actionable
- [ ] SKILL.md has prerequisites and troubleshooting
- [ ] Security issues addressed
- [ ] Integration tests exist and pass

title: Add missing requests dependency
description: requirements.txt is missing requests, which todoist_auth.py imports for direct token exchange.
design: Add requests>=2.25.0 to requirements.txt. Verify with fresh venv install.
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] requirements.txt includes requests>=2.25.0
- [ ] Fresh pip install -r requirements.txt succeeds
- [ ] todoist auth runs without ModuleNotFoundError

title: Add error handling guidance to SKILL.md
description: SKILL.md doesn't tell Claude what to do when CLI returns errors.
design: Add When CLI Errors section: common error patterns, what Claude should do, when to prompt user re-auth.
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] SKILL.md has error handling guidance
- [ ] Common CLI errors listed with recommended actions
- [ ] Claude knows when to suggest re-auth
- [ ] Claude knows when to escalate to user

title: Reconcile wrapper script setup
description: README says use alias, SKILL.md says wrapper at ~/.claude/scripts/todoist. Inconsistent.
design: Pick one approach (wrapper is better for Claude). Update both docs to match. Ensure examples work.
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] README and SKILL.md agree on CLI invocation
- [ ] Wrapper script approach documented clearly
- [ ] PATH setup instructions included
- [ ] Examples use consistent command name

title: Add LICENSE file
description: README says MIT license but no LICENSE file exists.
design: Create standard MIT LICENSE file with copyright holder.
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] LICENSE file exists
- [ ] MIT license text
- [ ] Copyright holder specified

title: Remove or relocate AGENTS.md
description: AGENTS.md duplicates content with .beads/README.md. Redundant.
design: Either delete AGENTS.md (bd handles this via .beads/) or merge useful content into .beads/README.md.
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] No redundant AGENTS.md at repo root
- [ ] Any useful content preserved in .beads/README.md
- [ ] git status clean (file removed or moved)

title: Fix token visibility in process list
description: Token passed via -w flag to security command is visible in ps output.
design: Use stdin piping instead: echo token | security add-generic-password -w (or similar). Token never in argv.
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] Token not visible in ps aux
- [ ] security add-generic-password still works
- [ ] Tested with ps -ef during auth

title: Strengthen manual mode CSRF handling
description: Manual mode continues even with state mismatch. CSRF protection effectively bypassed.
design: Show clear warning, offer to abort, log the decision. Don't silently continue.
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] State mismatch shows prominent warning
- [ ] User prompted to confirm continue
- [ ] Decision logged for audit
- [ ] Can abort and retry

title: Add token refresh/expiry detection
description: OAuth tokens can expire. No mechanism to detect or prompt re-auth.
design: Check for 401 on any API call. If detected, show clear message to re-auth. Maybe auto-initiate auth flow.
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] Expired token detected on API call
- [ ] Clear message: 'Token expired. Run todoist auth.'
- [ ] No cryptic SDK errors for expired token
- [ ] Optional: auto-launch re-auth

title: Add streaming for large datasets
description: collect_paginated() loads everything into memory. Accounts with thousands of tasks could cause memory issues.
design: Generator pattern for paginated results. Process and output incrementally. Consider max items flag.
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] collect_paginated uses generator/streaming
- [ ] Memory bounded even for 10k+ tasks
- [ ] Output still valid JSON (maybe JSONL for streaming?)
- [ ] No regression for normal use cases

title: Add --dry-run flag to write operations
description: No way to preview changes before executing add/update/done.
design: Add --dry-run to add, update, done. Show what would happen without executing.
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] todoist add X --dry-run shows task that would be created
- [ ] todoist update ID --dry-run shows changes
- [ ] todoist done ID --dry-run shows task that would complete
- [ ] No API calls made in dry-run mode

title: Add basic integration tests
description: No automated tests. Only manual validation.
design: pytest tests. Test argument parsing, mock API calls. CI-runnable (no real Todoist needed).
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] tests/ directory with pytest tests
- [ ] Argument parsing tested
- [ ] API interactions mocked
- [ ] Can run in CI without credentials
- [ ] pytest invocable from repo root

title: Fix resolve_project() ID detection heuristic
description: resolve_project() assumes anything without spaces/@/# is an ID, but project names like 'Personal', 'Inbox' pass this check and cause API errors.
design: Match resolve_section() pattern: try name lookup first, fall back to treating as ID. See todoist.py:104-126 for correct pattern.
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] todoist tasks --project Personal works
- [ ] todoist tasks --project Inbox works  
- [ ] todoist tasks --project "@Work" still works
- [ ] ID fallback still works for actual IDs
close_reason: Fixed resolve_project() to try name lookup first, then fall back to ID. Now handles 'Personal', 'Inbox' correctly.

title: Add verification script for acceptance criteria
description: No automated way to verify acceptance criteria from beads. Manual testing only.
design: Create scripts/verify.sh that runs key acceptance tests: auth status, name resolution, error handling.
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] scripts/verify.sh exists
- [ ] Tests auth --status
- [ ] Tests --project Personal resolution
- [ ] Tests invalid task ID error
- [ ] Exit 0 on success, 1 on failure

title: Review pre-session SKILL.md changes
description: SKILL.md has uncommitted changes predating this session. Unknown content, should review before committing.
design: git diff SKILL.md, assess changes, decide: commit as-is, amend, or discard.
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] SKILL.md changes reviewed
- [ ] Decision made (commit/amend/discard)
- [ ] No mystery uncommitted changes
close_reason: Reviewed SKILL.md changes (wrapper command cleanup), committed with .gitattributes and AGENTS.md

title: Add error handling for invalid task IDs
description: Invalid task IDs cause uncaught SDK exceptions with cryptic tracebacks instead of clean error messages.
design: Wrap api.get_task(), api.complete_task(), api.update_task() in try/except. Catch 404-like errors, print clean message, exit 1.
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] todoist task invalid-id-12345 shows clean error
- [ ] todoist done invalid-id shows clean error
- [ ] todoist update invalid-id --content x shows clean error
- [ ] No SDK traceback visible to user
close_reason: Added try/except around get_task, complete_task, update_task, move_task. Clean error messages on invalid task IDs.

title: Add port-in-use detection for OAuth
description: If port 8080 is in use, OAuth callback silently fails. No retry, no helpful error.
design: Try binding to 8080, catch OSError. Try 8081, 8082. If all fail, show clear error with the ports tried.
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] With port 8080 blocked, auth tries alternate port
- [ ] Or shows clear error listing ports tried
- [ ] User knows what to do (free port or use --manual)
close_reason: Added port fallback (8080-8084), clear error when all in use

title: Improve cross-workspace error detection
description: Cross-workspace move detection catches ALL 400 errors and assumes cross-workspace. Other 400 causes get misdiagnosed.
design: Check response body or specific exception type. Only show cross-workspace message for that specific error, let others propagate.
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] Cross-workspace move still shows helpful message
- [ ] Other 400 errors show actual error, not cross-workspace message
- [ ] Rate limit errors show rate limit message
close_reason: Rate limit detection, workspace-specific 400 handling, passthrough for unknown 400s

title: Add timeout handling for network operations
description: CLI has no timeout handling. Slow networks or API issues cause indefinite hangs.
design: Add default timeout (30s?). Consider --timeout flag. Clean error on timeout.
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] Network timeout shows clean error
- [ ] Default timeout prevents indefinite hang
- [ ] User can override with flag if needed
close_reason: 30s default timeout via httpx session, global handler for timeout/connection errors

title: Surface Keychain errors to user
description: Keychain failures silently return False. User has no idea why auth didn't persist.
design: Capture subprocess stderr/stdout. On failure, show what went wrong (locked, permissions, etc.).
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] Keychain access denied shows permissions message
- [ ] Keychain locked shows lock message
- [ ] User knows what to do to fix
close_reason: Surface Keychain locked/denied errors with actionable messages

title: Add Troubleshooting section to README
description: README.md has no troubleshooting section. Common errors undocumented.
design: Add section covering: auth failures, port conflicts, Keychain issues, cross-workspace moves. Based on audit findings.
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] README has Troubleshooting section
- [ ] Auth failures documented with solutions
- [ ] Port conflicts documented
- [ ] User can self-diagnose common issues

title: Add Prerequisites section to SKILL.md
description: SKILL.md lacks Prerequisites section per skill quality standards. No dependency listing or pre-flight checks.
design: Add Prerequisites section with: Python deps, wrapper script setup, jq (if used in examples), pre-flight check command.
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] SKILL.md has Prerequisites section
- [ ] Dependencies explicitly listed
- [ ] Pre-flight check script or command provided
- [ ] Claude knows what to verify before querying
